{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3299857,"name":"John blue","username":"johnblue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnblue/{size}/203057_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T23:45:58.129Z","cooked":"

IMG_79402268×4032 1.65 MB

On a NEO brushless motor (rev-21-1650): What is the white cable meaning?

Looking on rev site there isn’t a specific mention of the white cable that I could find. Any references welcome

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-01T23:45:58.129Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":582,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":2967.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"John blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/e/e/ee8616c2eb7c36bfb4b01a3bc563d302faf6d3c8.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61296,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3299865,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T23:53:41.051Z","cooked":"

Neos are brushless motors, which need 3 wires instead of the 2 that a brushed motor would need.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-01T23:53:41.051Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":125.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299866,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T23:54:10.257Z","cooked":"

Brushed motors have two power wires, a power and ground (red and black), and the brushes on the inside of the motor are contacts that cause alternating magnetic fields, which pulls the shaft around in a circle. Brushless motors don’t have the brushes, so the alternating magnetic fields are provided by three power channels, that turn on and off in sequence to propel the motor rotor and shaft to spin. The white, red, and black wires are all power wires, and need to be connected to the matching colors on the Spark MAX. You cannot connect them backwards to invert the motor.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-01T23:54:27.480Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":174.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/3","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299877,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:17:46.794Z","cooked":"

Because of this, they are sometimes called ‘phase wires’ because they connect to the motor phases.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T00:17:46.794Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":74.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/4","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299890,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:26:09.192Z","cooked":"
Amicus1:

You cannot connect them backwards to invert the motor.

Actually, swapping a pair of phase wires will make it go backwards, because it flips the commutation order. Don’t do that though because it’s confusing.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T00:26:42.042Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":61.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/5","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299894,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:32:38.347Z","cooked":"

Does that apply to sensored commutation as well? I assumed that was the limiting part.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T00:32:38.347Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":50.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/6","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299896,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:33:08.440Z","cooked":"

Yes. It worked on some AC induction motors I got to play with in college at least, which did have an encoder offset.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T00:34:12.053Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/7","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299900,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:40:38.900Z","cooked":"
calcmogul:

Don’t do that though because it’s confusing.

Also don’t do that because these are sensored motors and then the phases won’t match the encoder.

johnblue:

What is the white cable meaning?

Like was said above, the white cable is the same as the red and black, it is just one of the three phases. (red to black, black to white, white to red)

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T00:40:38.900Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452985,"topic_slug":"meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/meaning-of-white-cable-on-neo-brushless-motor/452985/8","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299903,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T00:49:52.570Z","cooked":"
Domtech:

Also don’t do that because these are sensored motors and then the phases won’t match the encoder.

If you swap the sensor leads as well, it should work. That’s not an option for FRC motors though.
